title: Junior Data Analyst (f/m/x)
description:
Junior Data Analyst (f/m/x)

The DCA & Data (the A stands for Avengers) department is on a mission to transform RBI’s digital marketing and grow our customer base. As a team of marketing and data professionals, our natural habitat is the digital universe with data building the foundation of all our work. Manual reports and colleagues filling in Excel sheets are your Kryptonite?

We’ll be happy if you join us on our mission!

#full-time / part-time

(38.5h / week)

#viennaoffice

(1030)

#homeoffice

possible

Your role at RBI
• assist our network banks & subsidiaries when it comes to implementing and verifying proper tracking (incl. tracking pixels, event tracking, cross domain tracking, UTM parameters, etc.) for digital performance campaigns, landing pages, etc.
• combine data to create dashboards and funnel visualizations that help to evaluate campaign and ad performance for the entire group
• support colleagues within the group with individual analytics needs and build standardized... dashboards for further business use
• support us in fostering a data-driven mindset by providing the data needed to make business decisions
• support various data projects within the Group Marketing Division but also across the entire banking group to improve our analytical capabilities
• align with stakeholders in- and outside of the Group Marketing Division, actively seek collaboration and opportunities to improve business performance
• work in a cross-functional and international data team and work alongside professionals in tracking, data analytics, science, and engineering

Your core competencies
• Degree in Mathematics, Data Science, or a related field
• Knowledge of Google Marketing Platform, especially Google Analytics (GA4) and BI tools (Power BI)
• Preferably you already have first experience as a Data Analyst
• You are familiar with SQL and have experience running queries
• Knowledge of event-based customer interactions, A/B testing and sales funnel management
• A curious mind that stays on top of industry standards and trends when it comes to data and especially marketing & performance data
• Proactivity and the eagerness to learn while shaping our division-wide understanding of a data-driven mindset
• Proficiency in English, both written and spoken, German is an advantage
• First experience in marketing data departments, especially working with different analytics tools for marketing business use cases, is a plus

What's in it for you
• Work Life Balance: flexible working hours & extensive hybrid working possibilities
• Career: possibility to develop personally & professionally
• Learning: as part of our DNA & culture
• Easy Commuting: free public transport pass
• Canteen: healthy, tasty, and heavily subsidized
• Leisure time activities: attractive sports and cultural offers (free museum tickets, reduced gym membership, etc.)
• Saving: with vouchers / discounts from our staffs' council (eg. for supermarkets)
• Family Friendly: family allowances, gender-neutral parental leave, part-time work etc.
• Salary: starting at EUR 40.000,- gross p.a. excluding overtime (market-compliant overpayment is provided dep. on experience / qualification)

At Raiffeisen Bank International, we are pleased to have more than 17 million customers in Austria and 12 other CEE countries – what got us here, are our talented people. From the moment you join RBI, you will notice our commitment to creating a working environment where everyone can thrive. Diversity and inclusion are essential components of our vision and mission and are reflected in our values: collaboration, proactivity, learning and responsibility. Our shared mission is to provide a superior customer experience by tackling new issues such as digitalization and changing needs.

For questions regarding our application process, please feel free to take a look on our website

or check out our FAQ.

Follow us on our RBI Account on LinkedIn

title: Senior Data Analyst/Architect (f/m/d/)
description:
Rethinking IT.

We have lots of ideas about how to successfully drive digitalization in companies. For example, with open cloud platforms, highly developed security systems, and clever tools for developers. What is your role in this? Move the world from behind the scenes with your IT expertise and passion for game-changing information technology. Rethink IT and steer projects in completely new directions. Be bold when others would have given up. In short, play a key role in driving digitalization forward! We’ll provide the resources you need to do this. We also offer a variety of opportunities to get involved and to be part of a global network of IT experts and professionals. Welcome to our world!

We make real what matters. This is your role.

Vision:

As data is supposed to be the new oil, making tangible value out of data will make the difference and is what we are striving for.

Supporting the business in decision making and answering increasingly complex questions in ever shorter... time or even real time is our aspiration.

Mission:

By combining a profound knowledge of finance and related end-2-end processes with deep technical know-how and a fresh thinking with respect to problem solving, we provide state of the art IT solutions, services and platforms for finance departments with a focus on reporting, analytics and planning.

Key Areas of Responsibility:
• Be the data architect in the relaunch of a solution for group consolidation with a focus on the provision of an integrated data layer that enables a pass-through from consolidated data to unconsolidated ERP data
• Permanent self-reliant optimization of data models (in the context of SAP BW/4, Snowflake, S/4HANA)
• You envision, design and implement architectures and data models optimized for the integration of various, heterogenous data sources. You extend our service offering by business intelligence and reporting solutions to effectively deal with the new non-financial reporting requirements like the EU Taxonomy.
• Autonomously deliver/lead projects mainly in the context of an SAP BW/4 environment
• Perform complex changes in alignment with BI colleagues and business stakeholders
• Constantly provide innovations to improve or enhance analytics related solutions and service offering
• Provide added value to data analytics initiatives / projects (migrations, predictive analytics, SAC, new projects)
• Manage and coordinate external partners and communicate with various business stakeholders for the successful completion of projects and changes in existing solutions

Use your skills to move the world forward.
• University degree in IT or Business Insights related field
• Many years of experience in analytics and reporting (SAP BW, SAP ABAP, SAP BW/4). Experience in an international group company and experience in SAP Group reporting are valued.
• Extensive experience in data warehousing, ETL processes and reporting (SAP AO, SAC)
• Knowledge on HANA Studio (SQL/Java Script), experience in cloud platforms, as well as any other BI tool are valued
• Practical experience in collaborating with business stakeholders, experience within the area of Accounting / Controlling / Closing process is valued
• Ability to learn and adapt to new environments / contexts / applications
• Business Value and Customer focused, as well as goal-oriented professional with innovative thinking and attention to detail and a team player
• Project Management experience in agile methodology
• Excellent interpersonal and communication skills and willingness to work in a multicultural team
• Strong engineering/analytic skills and in leading BI projects and data expertise (modelling, analytics, prediction, simulation, AI/ML) and profound background in digitalization technologies is highly valued
• Business fluent English and German

title: HR Data Analytics Specialist (all genders)
description:
• Location: Wien
• Working hours: Full-time
• Occupational Area: Human resources, IT
• Company: Erste Group Bank AG

Erste Group was founded in 1819 as the first Austrian savings bank and today it is one of the largest banking groups in Central and Eastern Europe (CEE). As an attractive employer, Erste Group offers interesting career opportunities in an international environment.

Are you an ambitious individual with a passion for data and a heart for HR? Are you excited about using data analytics, data science or visualisation to make a significant impact on HR processes and contribute to our community? If so, we have an incredible opportunity for you to join our team. Together we will rethink existing HR processes and analyse the latest technological developments and trends that could benefit us.

What to do:
• ​​​​​​Design, model and fully automate data from systems of record to systems of insights in collaboration with IT and HR colleagues
• Build and deploy people and culture... analytics insights across HR and the business to help build data-driven organisational capability and culture
• Support and work closely with the integration team and the implementation projects
• Liaise with HR reporting teams and data quality management teams in all Erste Group countries

You check these boxes:
• ​​​​​​​At least 3 years of experience in data analytics, data science and data visualisation
• Experience with one or more data analysis tools, programming languages and/or databases like Python, R, Tableau, Impala, ELK Stack, Hadoop, etc.
• Detailed understanding and experience of standard processes for developing and deploying advanced analytics use cases

Why you will like us:
• We are a team who live and breathe continuous improvement and digital transformation, opens the door for new opportunities and also push boundaries
• We are open minded, honest, supportive and always ready to go the extra mile for great solutions
• Interest groups and clubs: Take part in discussions and get involved in projects. Numerous interest groups invite you to engage with a topic
• Good food: Healthy nutrition and good food are important for our quality of life. With seven restaurants and cafeterias, there’s something to suit every taste on the Erste Campus
• Health Centre – The Erste Campus operates a fully equipped health centre that offers all employees a high standard of medical services during working hours.
• A competitive and performance-related salary dependent on your professional and personal qualifications is granted - the minimum wage for this position in accordance with the respective collective agreement is EUR 49.458,64,- gross per year. But this is just a formality - we would be happy to talk about your actual salary in person!

The way we are:

Erste Group considers the diversity of its employees as key to innovation and success. As employer we are proud to offer everyone equal chances, irrespective of age, skin colour, religious belief, gender, sexual orientation or origin

title: Junior Data Analyst (Remote Internship – Data Analysis)
description:
LOCATION: Remote Work

SCHEDULE: Part-time

Are you an aspiring data analyst seeking an unparalleled opportunity to gain hands-on experience while working with a prestigious Management Consulting firm? TalentKompass Deutschland, a leading Human Resources company based in Germany, is searching for a highly motivated Data Analysis Intern to join our esteemed client. This remote position offers a unique chance for someone who is passionate about data analysis and eager to learn in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.

As a Data Analysis Intern, you will work closely with the analytics and consulting teams, where you will be responsible for a range of tasks, including data collection, data cleaning, and statistical analysis. You will have the extraordinary opportunity to learn from experienced professionals who will provide mentorship and guidance throughout the internship. With this internship, you will gain valuable experience in data analysis, data visualization, and teamwork – all... essential skills for a successful career in this field.

Responsibilities:
• Collect, clean, and analyze data from various sources to support consulting projects
• Assist in the development of data models and statistical analysis to identify trends and insights
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and analyze data
• Create data visualizations and dashboards using tools such as Tableau or Power BI
• Present findings and insights to the consulting team and contribute to project reports
• Participate in brainstorming sessions and contribute ideas for data-driven solutions
• Support the team with general administrative tasks as needed

Requirements:
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
• Proficient in Microsoft Excel or other data analysis tools
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English
• Familiarity with data analysis principles and practices
• Ability to work independently and as part of a team
• Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
• Knowledge of statistical analysis tools and techniques is a plus
• Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI is a plus

At TalentKompass Deutschland, we are committed to helping our interns develop their skills and reach their full potential. Our client is a reputable Management Consulting firm that will provide invaluable experience in a competitive industry. Don't miss this fantastic opportunity to grow your career in data analysis – apply now

title: Senior Technical Analyst Data Warehouse (all genders)
description:
• Location: Wien
• Working hours: Full-time
• Occupational Area: IT
• Company: Erste Digital

Who we are

Erste Digital develops and maintains all relevant IT-solutions (e.g. SimCorp, Oracle DB/DWH, Web) in the area of Asset and Wealth Management in close co-operation with Erste Asset Management. Erste Asset Management coordinates and is responsible for all asset management activities of Erste Group amounting to more than € 68 billion. More than 400 employees develop and manage investment solutions for our investors in 7 different countries. We launched the first environmental fund in Austria 20 years ago - at a time when the topic was still a niche. Today, we manage EUR 15 billion in sustainability (as of 31.10.2022) and place sustainability at the heart of our business activities.

Join us in our agile environment to grow the services around a state-of-the-art Data Warehouse platform. The product development team consisting of business and IT experts will continue to act as... frontrunner for Erste Asset Data Management, Data Quality and Digitalization at Erste Group.

We are Erste Digital. We are #digitaltotheheart

What to do
• Taking a key role in the implementation of our strategic projects in close collaboration with different business units in the area of investment funds
• Coordinate the potential business analysts working for smaller initiative within the agreed roadmap
• Contribute to build up IT Data landscape within Erste Asset Management
• Translate business visions into project roadmaps, target architectures and solution designs
• Structure, analyze and specify business and technical requirements for IT applications
• Moderate workshops, execute business process & technical system analysis
• Coordinate the implementation of new features/user stories and set sprint commitments together with the team
• Assure proper IT delivery processes with focus on requirements engineering, delivery coordination with developers and project managers, testing and Go Live

You check these boxes
• Several years of experience in business analysis and data modelling on Data Warehouse implementation projects including tools and techniques.
• A proven track-record working in the IT complex Data Warehouse projects in financial sector
• Ideally have a background in securities business with strong desire to gain further understanding of Asset & Wealth Management
• Ability to use complex SQL to get additional information for detailing your requirements specifications or to further analyze the business requirements
• Experienced in “best practice delivery models/methods” for implementing high quality software products
• A good capability of analytical thinking and ability to write consistent requirements specifications
• Understanding of the necessity for testing and documentation of a software project
• Keen on understanding the “Big Picture” and breaking it down into sustainable IT solutions
• Embracing working in a complex, international environment, and the opportunities it delivers
• Fluent in English, German is an advantage

Why you will like us
• Possibility to benefit and learn from our international, talented and passionate community at Erste
• Great learning curve through ownership and creative freedom
• Interest groups and clubs: Take part in discussions and get involved in projects. Numerous interest groups invite you to engage with a topic
• Good food: Healthy nutrition and good food are important for our quality of life. With seven restaurants and cafeterias, there’s something to suit every taste on the Erste Campus
• Health Centre – The Erste Campus operates a fully equipped health center that offers all employees a high standard of medical services during working hours.
• New way of work: With our flexible working hours model we want to make your life less complicated. Combing the best of both worlds, remote and company time.
• Employee benefits – Benefit from special conditions for financial services and insurances, supermarkets, clothing stores and many more.
• Employee Referral Program – Become a talent scout for career opportunities in IT. We are rewarding every successful referral for Erste Digital
• Language courses for German & English – Learning a new language unites
• Visa Sponsoring – We support our employees with all the formalities associated with a relocation
• Work-Life-Balance – Home office, paternity leave, sabbatical, sports courses -– we support you in balancing work, family and leisure time
• A competitive and performance-related salary dependent on your professional and personal qualifications is granted - the minimum wage for this position in accordance with the respective collective agreement is EUR 56.448,- gross per year. But this is just a formality, we are more than happy to discuss your actual expectations.

The way we are

Erste Group considers the diversity of its employees as key to innovation and success. As employer we are proud to offer everyone equal chances, irrespective of age, skin colour, religious belief, gender, sexual orientation or origin

title: Data Analyst (m/f/d)
description:
We are looking for a highly motivated Data Analyst (m/f/d) with great communication skills who will work alongside a small team of talented and experienced analysts, use modern technology and methods, and continually push boundaries to further develop and expand our reporting suite. The ideal candidate should have advanced knowledge about analytics and a big passion and motivation for learning.

You will have an excellent opportunity to join a growing team that is developing and managing Sportradar’s digital advertising platform. Within the self-organized and agile analytics team, you will play an active role in developing Sportradar’s client-facing advertising services that we are further driving with our cutting-edge technologies and highly motivated team members.

THE CHALLENGE
• Interpreting data to inform decisions and tell accurate stories to our advertisers/stakeholders.
• Evaluating existing data sources and related products on a regular basis, performing QA and health checks... to ensure data integrity.
• Evaluation, Evolution & Implementation from concept to delivery using Machine Learning & AI to deliver projects which generate value to our end clients.
• Collaborating with sales, tech and product teams to design, implement and refine state-of-the-art digital dashboards.
• Helping Build & Scale the end-to-end process for Data Ingestion all the way through to end client reporting.
• Have a „get it done“ attitude and deliver superb work repeatedly.

YOUR PROFILE

Required:
• Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics, Software Engineering or similar
• Understanding of analytical processes, tools, methods
• Advanced knowledge of SQL or other analytical languages
• Good English communication skills (verbal and written)
• Strong consumer focus, ownership, urgency, and drive
• Analytically thinking/Problem Solver

Preferred:
• Understanding of AWS Toolset
• Experience with Data Visualization Tools
• Experience with Python (PySpark)

OUR OFFER:
• Be part of a startup-like culture within a global corporation
• Become part of one of the fastest-growing businesses in the digital sports environment and help us scale our operations
• Be part of a highly motivated, innovative, and dynamic team with people from more than 20 nationalities in our office
• Education and training, like German and English courses and Sportradar eAcademy
• Exciting job field with the opportunity for personal development
• Home office and flexible working hours
• Tickets for sports events and concerts, as well as darts, table football, and table tennis for after-work sports activities in the office
• Team activities, like Happy Hours or marathons

The minimum monthly salary for this position is according to the Collective Bargaining Agreement, overpayment will be considered depending on qualifications and working experience.

Buckle up, hold on tight and get ready for an incredible adrenaline-rush throughout this exciting ride with us: #maketheteam and shape your future as well as ours

title: Job in Germany: IT Data Analyst (m/f/d)
description: IT Data Analyst (m/f/d) Risk protection, pension provision, art, classic cars: we are top positioned in a wide variety of insurance lines. Always close to people, personally and digitally. Our team brings together tradition and modernity - with the highest quality of service and preferably with you as reinforcement. We look forward to receiving your application - &Go. Your advantages at Helvetia Company pension scheme Your fully employer-financed coverage for the future Flexible, mobile working Flexible 38h week, up to 60% mobile working & flexitime account. Vacation 30 days annual leave, additional non-working days (24.12. 31.12.) & occasion-related special leave days. Top transport links Travel allowance, convenient location & bicycle parking. Employee conditions and benefits Job bike/bike leasing, employee discounts & much more. Canteen at the headquarters For breathers with the best catering & free coffee specialties. Promotion & continuing education Whether technical or... management career, we promote your further development Health Company sports and subsidization of health measures. Benefits may vary depending on location and position. This is how you support us In your role, you will be responsible for implementing data-based solutions in the data and analytics environment using a modern analytics platform. In addition, you link different data sources to sophisticated analytical solutions with your conceptual vision. You will also work diligently on expanding the data warehouse into a data hub for more advanced topics in analytics and reporting. Equally professional, you advise our departments and develop solutions to questions and requirements in the field of analytics and reporting. In addition, the support of our strategic development in the area of data and analytics is on your agenda. Due to your structured way of working, we know that commissioning and managing external partners and developers is in the best hands with you. Last but not least, we trust in your team spirit when working with colleagues (m/f/d) of Helvetia Group in Switzerland as well as with your team at Helvetia Germany. With this you enrich our team Completed studies: business informatics, computer science or a comparable qualification or corresponding professional experience, preferably in the insurance industry. Knowledge of statistical methods and programming languages (e.g. Python, R) as well as SQL and MS Excel. Good understanding of the function of complex database technologies and experience in data modeling. Expertise in the application of data science methods and advanced analytics. Desire to build further expertise in the context of appropriate trainings Good English as well as very good written and spoken German The optimal mix of communication skills, assertiveness and a clear hands-on mentality Place of work: Frankfurt am Main Type of employment: Permanent position Career status: Experienced Work model: hybrid working / home office Interested? Take the first step and apply online, stating your salary expectations and earliest possible start date. Please note that salary estimates displayed on job portals may differ from the actual salary range. More about Helvetia as an employer: www.helvetia.de | helvetia_deutschland Your contact for questions: Chiara Bosse HR Business Partner 49 69 1332-690

title: Lead Analyst, Data Architect
description:
At AES, we raise the quality of life around the world by changing the way energy works. Everyone makes an impact every day in our small, global teams. Apply here to start an extraordinary career today.

At AES, we have an amazing opportunity to transform the world with renewable energy. As one of the larger provides of renewable energy globally, we are dedicated to using the vast amounts of information available to design Clean Energy related solutions to improve our operations and become the global leader in renewable energy generation.

You will be part of the Clean Energy Digital Analytics Team, reporting to the Digital Analytics Manager, and your primary focus will be supporting the AES Clean Energy Business and as a data architect you are going to be part of a team of innovators who translate business requirements into technology requirements and define data standards, practices and principles. The data architect is responsible for partnering with the data Architects and work... collaboratively with the business and design the data management framework for various business projects at AES. The framework describes the processes used to plan, specify, enable, create, acquire, maintain, use, archive, retrieve, control, and purge data. The data architect also provides the business a standard common business vocabulary, expressing strategic requirements, outlining high-level integrated designs to meet those requirements, and aligns with the broader enterprise strategy and related business architecture.

Your Role and Responsibilities:

Data Architects are a key part of AES's digital transformation. The focus of this role would be on the planning and designing of data different frameworks, master data management MDM and pipelines with a main emphasis on the concepts of efficiently designing and implementing on our cloud-based Enterprise Data Lake. Working hand to hand with the Enterprise/Solution Architects and Data Engineers to create/implement plans to improve existing data models and structure the tables with the design pattern that will help the system for improved performance. Generally, a data architect has and in-depth knowledge and expertise of database technologies, along with solid programming, design, and system analysis skills, but is not required to be successful. Willingness to learn new technologies that can help improve the current system.

The Work You May Do:

· Interact with key team leaders and managers to understand their data requirements and play a key role in driving the data design forward with the data engineers

· Translation of business requirements and business operation practices into the existing technology data framework

· Manage the metadata for various enterprise data pipelines

· Define and design pipelines and processes for cleaning and organizing data as well as build tools to help make the data accessible by data scientists and the business

· Leverage Google Cloud Platform and similar tools

· Understand and support a corporate data model and overall data governance

· Communicate with application, back-office and external customer teams regarding data requirements, standards, performance and access

· Define and perform unit testing of database code as appropriate

· Perform code reviews and audits of application team’s database code to ensure compliance with established best practices

· Use big data analytics tools and apply techniques for data retrieval, preparation and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using various data engineering tools and methods

· Build integrations (API, etc.) with on-premise and cloud databases

· You have a solid understanding of programming languages extensively used in Data Science applications (e.g., R, Python, Scala, Java, etc.)

· Debug, troubleshoot, design and implement solutions to complex technical issues

· Build capabilities with software tools (e.g. Google Cloud Platform)

· Work in an Agile, collaborative environment, partnering with other scientists, Architects, and database administrators of all backgrounds and disciplines to bring analytical rigor and statistical methods to the challenges of predicting behaviors.

· Designing and implementing data solutions for operational and secure integration across systems

· Demonstrating solutions by developing documentation, flowcharts, layouts, diagrams, charts, code comments and clear code

· Improving operations by conducting systems analysis to understand process and application bottlenecks; recommending changes in policies and procedures

· Leverage Agile, CI/CD and DevOps methodologies to deliver high quality product on-time

Who You Are:

· You have a knack for transforming data and migrating data in cloud platforms leveraging cloud native tools

· Ask questions and love to learn

· Desire to get a detailed knowledge of the way AES does business today, and its plans for changes in practices and goals, either leading or supporting

· You have experience building high-capacity data analytics systems using cloud platforms and services for storing, collecting, and analyzing data (Google Cloud preferred)

· Love to tinker and understand the “why”.

· You have the ability to deal with ambiguity and the flexibility to change direction as additional information becomes available.

· Understand the value and purpose of good project management.

Required Professional and Technical Expertise:

· Bachelors degree in computer science, software engineering or a closely related field; a Master's degree is preferred

· 2 + years of experience developing batch and streaming ETL processes (preferably Talend)

· 2 + years of experience with relational and NoSQL databases, including modeling and writing complex queries

· 2 years of development experience leveraging an Agile methodology with experience collaborating on coding projects in Google Cloud Platform

· 2+ years of industry experience with modern programming languages like Python (preferred), Java, etc.

· 1+ years of industry experience with graph databases like Neo4j or Tiger Graph (preferred)

· Exposer to columnar cloud databases preferably BigQuery

· Exposure to relational database platforms like Microsoft, Oracle, etc.

· Progressive mindset particularly around deployment models and emerging technologies

· 2 + years of experience in Cloud Engineering, experience in a similar role with demonstrated relationship building skills resulting in traceable, measurable, impactful results

· Experience working in team environments and implementing organizational change

At AES, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our outstanding Check-In approach where feedback flows freely

title: Data Analyst (m/f/x)
description:
Start your tech career made in Austria as Data Analyst (m/f/x). Develop yourself and with us the software solutions of tomorrow.

YOUR TECH-PART
• Develop and further support of our data warehouse (DWH)
• Modeling of the data and incorporation of new requirements into the existing DWH model
• Design and development of required aggregations and datamarts as well as data provisioning in DWH
• Preparation and analysis of the data as well as provision of the data to the buyers/data consumers
• Collaboration in the development of a data catalog
• Collaboration on the topics of real-time data warehouse, business intelligence, reporting, big data analytics
• Create graphical reports using Power BI or Excel and assist with data analysis

YOUR TECH-STACK
• Completed technical education (HTL, computer science studies, FH, etc.)
• Relevant professional experience in the field of data modeling/data analysis
• Knowledge of DWH data modeling and DWH architectures
• Very good SQL knowledge
•... Interest in data analysis and data visualization
• Advantage: Experience in building a data catalog
• Nice to have: Experience in the area of realtime data processing incl. programming

OUR FEATURES

State-of-the-Art Technologies

We understand the usage of State-of-the-Art-Technologies as part of our mission.

Modern Company

That means for you: flat hierarchies, interdisciplinary teams and wide-ranging opportunities for self-realisation.

Attractive working environment

Lifephase oriented adaption possibilities, Homeoffice, flexible working hours, individual & systematic training, ergonomic workplace, top hardware and much more.

Explicit willingness to overpay

You offer more than required? Perfect, we do too! Dependent on your qualifications and experience we agree on your real salary. The annual gross salary for this position is at least at € 50.000 (full-time).

OUR TOP-BENEFITS
• Additional day off on your birthday
• Additional days off for all-in contracts in between holidays (up to 5 days per year)
• Parking space or very good public transport connections
• Relocation-Support
• Lunch allowance + fruits + drinks
• Regular team events
• Various discounts + gifts
• Sustainable collaboration + diversity

title: Business Data Analyst (m/w/d) für Sustainability Data Management...
description:
Wir sind seit 30 Jahren Unternehmensberater*innen für Umwelt und Nachhaltigkeit mit rund 200 Spezialist*innen – führend in Mittel- und Osteuropa verteilt auf 9 Standorte und 6 Länder und weltweit aktiv.

Obwohl das Thema Nachhaltigkeit ernst ist - mit uns macht es Spaß, daran zu arbeiten. Jede*r Einzelne arbeitet mit Expertise und Leidenschaft daran, Unternehmen am Weg zu einem grünen Business zu begleiten – wie groß die Herausforderungen auch sein mögen.

Zur Verstärkung unseres Teams suchen wir ab sofort eine*n

Business Data Analyst (m/w/d)

für Sustainability Data Management und Reporting

Wien, 40h/Woche

Nachhaltigkeits-Reporting ist einem ständigen Wandel unterzogen und systematische softwaregestützte Berichterstattung von Nachhaltigkeitskennzahlen steht relativ am Anfang. Aus diesem Grund ist fundiertes Data Management, sowie prüfsichere Data Governance-Strukturen für ESG-Daten (Environment, Social, Governance) für Unternehmen von zunehmender strategischer Bedeutung. Hier... kannst Du Dich einbringen und die Entwicklung von unterschiedlichen, passgenauen Lösungen für Unternehmen vorantreiben. Um die individuellen Anforderungen der Unternehmen zu erfüllen, kannst Du Deine Kreativität einsetzen und neue Lösungsansätze entwickeln.

Genau dies ist Deine Leidenschaft: Du betreust Unternehmen aus verschiedenen Sektoren dabei, ihr Nachhaltigkeits-Datenmanagement aufzubauen und zu verbessern. Dies umfasst etwa Kennzahlen aus allen ESG-Bereichen (Daten zu Treibhausgas-Emissionen, Energie, Wasser, nachhaltigen Produkten, Rohstoffen und Abfällen, Biodiversität, Gesundheit und Sicherheit der Mitarbeiter*innen, Diversity, Business Ethics etc.) effizient aufzubereiten, so dass eine sinnvolle Steuerung möglich ist.

Deine Aufgaben
• Sustainability Data Analytics: effektive Datenerhebung, Data Pipelining (ETLs), an unterschiedliche Systeme und Schnittstellen anknüpfen, vom Interpretieren und Visualisieren von ESG-Daten bis hin zur Kommunikation und Ableitung von Schlussfolgerungen
• Business Intelligence managen: notwendige ESG Datenarchitektur in verschiedenen Unternehmen umsetzen und bestehenden Business Intelligence-Lösungen (weiter)entwickeln,
• IT-Systeme in Richtung Nachhaltigkeit (weiter)entwickeln: Regulatorische Anforderungen im Nachhaltigkeits-Reporting in bestehenden und neue innovative IT-Lösungen übersetzen
• Sparringpartner*in für Kunden und Kundinnen sowie Mitarbeiter*innen bezüglich Datenmanagementprozesse für ESG: entwickeln, begleiten und implementieren von Datenmanagementprozessen direkt in Unternehmen, Zusammenarbeit mit Stakeholder*innen in der Data Governance

Dein Profil
• Abgeschlossenes einschlägiges Hochschulstudium wie z B. (Wirtschafts-)Informatik, Data Science, Data Analytics, Physik, Mathematik, Umweltwissenschaften, Wirtschaft mit quantitativer Spezialisierung
• Mind. 2 Jahre praktische Erfahrung im Bereich (Business) Data Analysis, Datenmanagement, Software Development
• Inhaltliche und konzeptionelle Expertise im Umgang mit Business Intelligence Lösungen (wie Power BI, Looker, Tableau, SAP, SAS Business Intelligence, etc.)
• Kenntnisse in Python, SQL, R von Vorteil
• Sehr gute Kenntnis von Statistik, Machine Learning und Datenvisualisierung
• Gute Projektmanagementkenntnisse in Theorie und Praxis
• Hohe Analyse- und Problemlösungsfähigkeiten
• Verhandlungssichere Englischkenntnisse

Unser Angebot
• Vielfältige und spannende Themen, in einem werteorientierten Umfeld, bei dem Du jeden Tag aufs Neue einen Beitrag zum Klimaschutz leistest
• Vielfältige Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten innerhalb der Organisation
• Alle-ziehen-an-einem-Strang-Kultur, 'Du'-Kultur
• Flexible Arbeitszeiten, mit vielen Freiräumen, flachen Hierarchien und der Möglichkeit rasch Verantwortung zu übernehmen
• Starke Lernkultur und Raum für Entwicklung
• Modernes Büro mit guter öffentlicher Erreichbarkeit (Nähe U-Bahn-Station Hietzing U4) und die Möglichkeit auf Remote Arbeit
• Frisch gekochtes nachhaltiges Essen 4x/Woche durch unseren eigenen Koch
• Das Gehalt orientiert sich an Deiner Qualifikation und Erfahrung, ab € 50.000 brutto/Jahr plus variabler Vergütung. Zusätzlich gibt es ein attraktives Bonusmodell.

Du möchtest mit Deinen analytischen Skills im Bereich Datenanalyse täglich etwas zum Klimaschutz beitragen? Du bist innovativ und gestaltest gerne mit? Du brennst für Nachhaltigkeit und bringst Humor und positive Energie mit? Dann sollten wir uns unbedingt kennen lernen!

Lade gleich Deine Bewerbung hoch! Für Fragen steht Dir als Ansprechpartnerin Doris Führer-Rösener zur Verfügung.

Du willst mehr Informationen über uns? Sieh mal hier rein: www.denkstatt.eu

title: Data Analyst (m/f/d)
description:
We are looking for a highly motivated Data Analyst (m/f/d) with great communication skills who will work alongside a small team of talented and experienced analysts, use modern technology and methods, and continually push boundaries to further develop and expand our reporting suite. The ideal candidate should have advanced knowledge about analytics and a big passion and motivation for learning.

You will have an excellent opportunity to join a growing team that is developing and managing Sportradar’s digital advertising platform. Within the self-organized and agile analytics team, you will play an active role in developing Sportradar’s client-facing advertising services that we are further driving with our cutting-edge technologies and highly motivated team members.

THE CHALLENGE
• Interpreting data to inform decisions and tell accurate stories to our advertisers/stakeholders.
• Evaluating existing data sources and related products on a regular basis, performing QA and health checks... to ensure data integrity.
• Evaluation, Evolution & Implementation from concept to delivery using Machine Learning & AI to deliver projects which generate value to our end clients.
• Collaborating with sales, tech and product teams to design, implement and refine state-of-the-art digital dashboards.
• Helping Build & Scale the end-to-end process for Data Ingestion all the way through to end client reporting.
• Have a „get it done“ attitude and deliver superb work repeatedly.

YOUR PROFILE

Required:
• Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics, Software Engineering or similar
• Understanding of analytical processes, tools, methods
• Advanced knowledge of SQL or other analytical languages
• Good English communication skills (verbal and written)
• Strong consumer focus, ownership, urgency, and drive
• Analytically thinking/Problem Solver

Preferred:
• Understanding of AWS Toolset
• Experience with Data Visualization Tools
• Experience with Python (PySpark)

OUR OFFER:
• Be part of a startup-like culture within a global corporation
• Become part of one of the fastest-growing businesses in the digital sports environment and help us scale our operations
• Be part of a highly motivated, innovative, and dynamic team with people from more than 20 nationalities in our office
• Education and training, like German and English courses and Sportradar eAcademy
• Exciting job field with the opportunity for personal development
• Home office and flexible working hours
• Tickets for sports events and concerts, as well as darts, table football, and table tennis for after-work sports activities in the office
• Team activities, like Happy Hours or marathons

The minimum monthly salary for this position is according to the Collective Bargaining Agreement, overpayment will be considered depending on qualifications and working experience.

Buckle up, hold on tight and get ready for an incredible adrenaline-rush throughout this exciting ride with us: #maketheteam and shape your future as well as ours

title: Data Analyst Marktforschung Pharma Österreich (w/m/d)
description:
Wir bieten
• Mitarbeit in einem wachstumsstarken Unternehmen mit langfristiger Perspektive
• Einbindung in ein dynamisches und kollegiales Arbeitsumfeld
• motivierte und engagierte Teams
• flache Hierarchien und offene Kommunikation
• eigenverantwortliche Tätigkeit mit abwechslungsreichen Aufgabenstellungen
• regelmäßige interne und externe Fortbildungsmöglichkeiten sowie persönliche Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten
• flexible Arbeitszeiten
• mobiles Arbeiten in Abstimmung möglich
• Mitarbeiterevents (gemeinsame Feste, Ausflüge etc.)

Ihre Aufgaben
• Erstellung von kundenindividuellen Datenanalysen
• Verantwortung für das Datenqualitätsmanagement bei der Betreuung von Kunden in Österreich
• Ergebnisaufbereitung und Präsentation der Analysen mit MS-Office Anwendungen, sowie spezieller Software zur Datenanalyse
• Betreuung, Administration und Durchführung von Kundenschulungen für die firmeneigene Software IH Galaxy NG
• selbständiges, kontinuierliches Einarbeiten in das für den Fachbereich... notwendige Fachwissen

Ihre Stärken
• kaufmännische und/oder IT-orientierte Ausbildung oder entsprechenden Studienabschluss
• Interesse am Gesundheitsmarkt, idealerweise mit Vorkenntnissen
• schnelle Auffassungs- und Umsetzungsgabe in der Auswertung von Daten
• ausgezeichnete MS-Excel Kenntnisse und analytische Auffassungsfähigkeit
• Flexibilität, Teamfähigkeit sowie selbstverantwortliche Arbeitsweise
• Freude am Kundenkontakt

Neugierig geworden?

Wenn Sie Interesse haben, uns aktiv zu unterstützen, dann freuen wir uns auf Ihre Online-Bewerbung mit Lebenslauf. Bitte teilen Sie uns Ihren frühestmöglichen Eintrittstermin und Ihre

Gehaltsvorstellung mit.

Das Jahresbruttoeinkommen für diese Position beträgt mindestens 35.000 Euro in Abhängigkeit Ihrer beruflichen Qualifikation und Erfahrung. Selbstverständlich behandeln wir Ihre Daten vertraulich.

Wir freuen uns auf Ihre Bewerbung!

Ansprechpersonen

Mag. Ursula Scheithauer

Ingeborg Weiler

IWeiler@insighthealth.at

INSIGHT Health GmbH & Co. KG

Hoher Markt 4/2 Top 7

1010 Wien

Tel.: +43 1 934 66 16

www.insighthealth.at

Über uns

INSIGHT Health ist ein Big Data-Dienstleister mit einem breiten Spektrum von Gesundheitsdaten zur Markt- und Versorgungsforschung. Unser Team verfügt über eine große Expertise im Gesundheitsmarkt und analysiert seit 1999 Massendaten für Kunden aus der pharmazeutischen Industrie, aus Politik, Behörden und Krankenkassen. Hierbei kombinieren wir Beratungskompetenz mit anspruchsvollen Analyseverfahren, mit einer modernen und skalierfähigen Datenplattform

title: Data Analyst (m/f/x)
description:
Start your tech career made in Austria as Data Analyst (m/f/x). Develop yourself and with us the software solutions of tomorrow.

YOUR TECH-PART
• Develop and further support of our data warehouse (DWH)
• Modeling of the data and incorporation of new requirements into the existing DWH model
• Design and development of required aggregations and datamarts as well as data provisioning in DWH
• Preparation and analysis of the data as well as provision of the data to the buyers/data consumers
• Collaboration in the development of a data catalog
• Collaboration on the topics of real-time data warehouse, business intelligence, reporting, big data analytics
• Create graphical reports using Power BI or Excel and assist with data analysis

YOUR TECH-STACK
• Completed technical education (HTL, computer science studies, FH, etc.)
• Relevant professional experience in the field of data modeling/data analysis
• Knowledge of DWH data modeling and DWH architectures
• Very good SQL knowledge
•... Interest in data analysis and data visualization
• Advantage: Experience in building a data catalog
• Nice to have: Experience in the area of realtime data processing incl. programming

OUR FEATURES

State-of-the-Art Technologies

We understand the usage of State-of-the-Art-Technologies as part of our mission.

Modern Company

That means for you: flat hierarchies, interdisciplinary teams and wide-ranging opportunities for self-realisation.

Attractive working environment

Lifephase oriented adaption possibilities, Homeoffice, flexible working hours, individual & systematic training, ergonomic workplace, top hardware and much more.

Explicit willingness to overpay

You offer more than required? Perfect, we do too! Dependent on your qualifications and experience we agree on your real salary. The annual gross salary for this position is at least at € 50.000 (full-time).

OUR TOP-BENEFITS
• Additional day off on your birthday
• Additional days off for all-in contracts in between holidays (up to 5 days per year)
• Parking space or very good public transport connections
• Relocation-Support
• Lunch allowance + fruits + drinks
• Regular team events
• Various discounts + gifts
• Sustainable collaboration + diversity
• ADMIRALfit

and much more.

YOUR CONTACT

Stephan Ganzinger

Stephan.Ganzinger@admiral.at

You offer more than required? Perfect, we do too! Dependent on your qualifications and experience we agree on your real salary. The annual gross salary for this position is at least at € 50.000 (full-time).

OUR TOP-BENEFITS
• Additional day off on your birthday
• Additional days off for all-in contracts in between holidays (up to 5 days per year)
• Parking space or very good public transport connections
• Relocation-Support
• Lunch allowance + fruits + drinks
• Regular team events
• Various discounts + gifts
• Sustainable collaboration + diversity
• ADMIRALfit

and much more.

YOUR CONTACT

Stephan Ganzinger

Stephan.Ganzinger@admiral.at']}]

title: CRM & Loyalty Data Scientist (m/f/x)
description:
Company Description

We are looking for a Data Scientist to analyze large amounts of raw information to find patterns that will help improve our company. We will rely on you to build data products to extract valuable business insights.

In this role, you should be highly analytical with a knack for analysis, math and statistics. Critical thinking and problem-solving skills are essential for interpreting data. We also want to see a passion for machine-learning and research.

Your goal will be to help our company analyze trends to make better decisions.

Job Description
• Identify valuable data sources and automate collection processes
• Undertake preprocessing of structured and unstructured data
• Analyze large amounts of information to discover trends and patterns
• Build predictive models and machine-learning algorithms
• Combine models through ensemble modeling
• Present information using data visualization techniques
• Propose solutions and strategies to business challenges
•... Collaborate with engineering and product development teams

Qualifications
• Completed studies in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Data Science or other quantitative field
• Proven experience as a Data Scientist or Data Analyst
• Understanding of machine-learning and operations research
• Knowledge of R, SQL and Python, familiarity with Scala, Java or C++ is an asset
• Experience using business intelligence tools (e.g. Tableau) and data frameworks (e.g. Hadoop)
• Analytical mind and business acumen
• Strong math skills (e.g. statistics, algebra)
• Problem-solving aptitude
• Excellent communication and presentation skills

Additional Information
• Long-term, interesting and varied work for a reliable employer in a supportive team
• A family-friendly company culture with flexible working hours and remote working options available according to your individual needs
• Numerous training and further development opportunities within the Group (5% of working time for self-organized training and education)
• Staff shopping and travel discounts
• Easy public access
• An industry-standard, attractive and performance based annual gross salary starting at 40.000 Euro (on a full-time basis) with the possibility of higher pay according to experience and qualifications

No matter where you are in your career, we have a path for you. Whether you’re looking for your first job, advancement in your field, or a new career shift. We’re proud to employ great people who are passionate about their jobs. But they’re all different. No matter who you are, what you need and where you’re going, REWE Group can be a part of it. Apply now!

We promote a diverse and inclusive work environment. Therefore, we welcome applications from people of different gender, age, cultural or social background, sexual identity and applications from people with disabilities

title: Data Analyst mit Fokus auf Power BI
description:
﻿

Als eine der führenden Versicherungen wissen wir, dass wir gemeinsam mehr bewegen können. Bei UNIQA sind wir deshalb die Gemeinschaft für ein besseres Leben. Wir nutzen unsere individuellen Fähigkeiten, um zusammen eine bessere Zukunft zu gestalten. Erzähle uns von deinen Stärken und bewirb dich als Data Analyst mit Fokus auf Power BI

Das erwartet dich:
• Erstellung und Weiterentwicklung von Berichten mit Hilfe von Power BI
• Aufbau von Datenmodellen in Power BI
• Selbständige Aufbereitung der Rohdaten in SAS
• Mitgestaltung der Design-Vorgaben unserer Berichte
• Kommunikation und Abstimmung der Berichte mit der Zielgruppe
• Mitarbeit in einem jungen, engagierten und aufgeschlossenen Team

Wir erwarten uns:
• Studium im Bereich Informatik, Statistik, Mathematik oder Betriebswirtschaft mit analytischen Schwerpunkten (abgeschlossen oder laufend)
• Kenntnisse in Tools für Datenvisualisierung wie Power BI, Tableau, etc.
• Erfahrung im Bereich Datenmanagement
• Idealerweise... Vorkenntnisse mit SAS oder einer anderen statistischen Software
• Selbständige Arbeitsweise sowie Teamfähigkeit
• Offene Persönlichkeit, Freude an der Weitergabe von Wissen
• Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englisch-Kenntnisse

Du passt zu uns, wenn du:
• einfache und realisierbare Lösungen findest
• Kund:innenbedürfnissen oberste Priorität zuschreibst
• gerne Verantwortung übernimmst
• Worten Taten folgen lässt und dadurch Vertrauen schaffst

Wir bei UNIQA leben Vielfalt. Wir setzen auf unterschiedliche Perspektiven in unseren Teams und Führungspositionen. Daher freuen wir uns sehr über Bewerbungen, die unsere Vielfalt bereichern.

Du bist dir nicht sicher, ob dein Profil unseren Anforderungen entspricht? Bewirb dich trotzdem! UNIQA sucht nach Kandidat:innen mit Ambition, Mut zur Veränderung und Begeisterungsfähigkeit!
JOB KEY FACTS

Standort: Wien, AT
Stundenausmaß: 20
Jährliches Mindestgehalt Brutto (Euro): 23.033
Startdatum: ab sofort Aus datenschutzrechtlichen Gründen können wir Bewerbungen nur über unser Recruiting-Portal annehmen. Bitte bewirb dich online mit Klick auf „
Jetzt bewerben“.

Du strebst nach Mehr als dem Minimum - wir ebenso! Dein tatsächliches Gehalt vereinbaren wir abhängig von deiner Ausbildung und deiner Erfahrung im Zuge des Recruitingprozesses.

Wir freuen uns, dich im Rahmen eines Erstgespräches virtuell kennen zu lernen. Weitere Gespräche werden in Folge vor Ort in unserer Zentrale im UNIQA Tower in Wien durchgeführt.

Deine Vorteile auf einen Blick:
• Attraktive Karrierechancen und breites Angebot an Weiterbildung
• Betriebliche Altersvorsorge
• Büro im Herzen der Stadt
• Familienfreundliches Unternehmen mit Zusatzleistungen
• Flexible Arbeitszeit durch Gleitzeitvereinbarungen, Möglichkeit von Home Office
• Herausfordernde Themen in einem dynamischen Arbeitsumfeld
• Multinationales Arbeitsumfeld und Zusammenarbeit in der gesamten UNIQA Insurance Group
Deine Ansprechperson

Larissa Hirsch
Recruiting Expert
Untere Donaustraße 21
A - 1029 Wien
larissa.hirsch@uniqa.at

title: Data Analyst /m/w/d/ - with Great Benefits
description:
We are searching for a confident Data Analyst (m/w/d) to join our diverse team at globe personal service gmbh in Wien.
Growing your career as a Full Time Data Analyst (m/w/d) is a great opportunity to develop excellent skills.
If you are strong in teamwork, problem-solving and have the right mindset for the job, then apply for the position of Data Analyst (m/w/d) at globe personal service gmbh today!

Our client is one of the world's most successful pharmaceutical companies. The company offers an extensive product range of prescription drugs, vaccines and veterinary medicines. The company has succeeded in developing innovative, therapeutic solutions for some of the most serious diseases, thus helping to improve the health and quality of life of people affected. The employees share the vision of improving the health of people worldwide. They work with great dedication to further develop optimal solutions.

We are currently looking for a

Data Analyst (m/w/d)

20h – 38,5h / week

In... this position you have the focus on very specific Salesforce Effectiveness Reports and support the operational process surrounding these:
Your Responsibilities:
• Identify and implement Key Performance Indicators and visual reports to support Business Units and customer facing teams in their decision-making process
• Support the Salesforce Effectiveness Manager in the Segmentation & Targeting Process, Sales Incentive Plan and other commercial processes through robust analysis and execution
• Support ad-hoc Salesforce Effectiveness reporting requests and Veeva CRM topics

Required qualifications and competences
• Student Worker Ongoing or completed studies from an accredited university, preferably in sciences, analytics, business, or relevant practical experience with data or business analysis
• Understanding of databases and ability to write simple queries in SQL
• Analytical thinking skills
• Basic understanding in using business intelligence software (e.g., Qlik, PowerBI, Spotfire)
• Excellent command of English (C1- Level), intermediate German skills (B1/B2-Level)
• First touchpoints with analytical, data-centric systems and tools (e.g., CRM System, specifically Salesforce CRM or Veeva CRM and proprietary reporting systems)
• Familiarity with pharma analytics and pharma-specific datasets (e.g., Veeva CRM, sales panel data, etc.) are a plus

Offer
• For this position we offer a minimum salary of 1.945 EUR gross p.m (Full-time basis). Depending on your qualifications and work experience, the actual salary may certainly be higher.
• Limited until December 2023
• Bonus scheme
• Team oriented and modern company culture
• International work environment and cooperation
• Attractive additional benefits

We are very much looking forward to receiving your application and we will be pleased to provide you further details upon request.

globe personal services GmbH
Mag. Claudia Geyerhofer
DC Tower – Donau City Straße 7 in 1220 Wien
M: Telefonnummer auf karriere.at ansehen
www.globe.at

Benefits of working as a Data Analyst (m/w/d) in Wien:

● Company offers great benefits
● Company offers career progression opportunities
● Competitive salary

title: Data Analyst, (25-38.5 Stunden)
description:
Talentbase .tech, die #1 Junior dev Plattform in Österreich, sucht derzeit Data Analysten für ein bekanntes Fertighausunternehmen Österreichs und einen der führenden Anbieter in Europa mit über 50.000 glücklichen Kunden in den letzten 60 Jahren.Aufgaben
• Erhebung und Abstimmung von Berichts-Anforderungen hinsichtlich Inhalt und Layout in Zusammenarbeit mit Business Stakeholdern.
• Erfassung existierender Datenquellen und in Folge Beratung von Business Stakeholdern in der Erarbeitung passender Berichtsstrukturen, welche die erhobenen Anforderungen adressieren.
• Erstellung von Ad-hoc Auswertungen unter Einbindung einer oder mehrere Datenquellen.
• Optimierung bestehender Berichte hinsichtlich Datenstruktur und Berichtslayout.
• Erstellung von Datenbank-Views und Tabellen zur Unterstützung im Reporting und zur Nutzung durch das Software-Entwicklungsteam.
• Identifikation von Verbesserungs-Optionen und in Folge kontinuierliche Verbesserung und Vereinheitlichung von Reporting-Strukturen... und Abläufen.
• Mitarbeit an der kontinuierlichen Verbesserung und Weiterentwicklung der bestehenden Datenarchitektur.Qualifikation

Erforderlich
• SQL

Hilfreich
• MS Excel
• Python
• R
• Power BI

Dies ist eine Stelle von Talentbase .tech! Mit einem professionellen Lebenslauf-Generator ermöglicht Talentbase .tech einfache Bewerbungen für Junior-Tech-Jobs mit nur einem Klick

title: Business Analyst for Counterparty Data Hub Servicing (all genders)
description:
• Location: Wien
• Working hours: Full-time
• Occupational Area: Sonstige
• Company: Erste Group Bank AG

Erste Group was founded in 1819 as the first Austrian savings bank and today it is one of the largest banking groups in Central and Eastern Europe (CEE). As an attractive employer, Erste Group offers interesting career opportunities in an international environment.

We in Daily Banking Services want to provide to our clients the best digital experience, which is seamless, convenient, fast and compliant. We aim to digitalize and automatize all our back-office processes to the core, regardless of channels. Customer Data Hub is one of our key systems to provide business support to all Erste Group Banks and meet regulatory requirements. We are currently seeking a talented and experienced Business Analyst to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for analyzing business processes and identifying opportunities for improvement. You will work closely with other members of the... Servicing team to implement changes and enhance efficiency in banking operations.

Your Tasks
• ​​​​​​You will have a crucial role in designing, documenting, and continuously improving our processes end to end and front to back
• Work closely with stakeholders, end users, product- and other process owners to define desired outcome of each process improvements or digitalization
• Responsible to achieve defined targets (KPIs) for process improvements and digitalization
• Responsible to manage the success and efficiency of processing Units
• Actively collect customer feedback to drive the re-design and enhancement of end-to-end processes
• Identify data quality issues and work with the appropriate teams to resolve them
• Act as competency for complex inquiries towards our stakeholders from stakeholders, business and service providers

Your Background
• ​​​​​​At least five years background in the banking industry, in process improvement or operations, with strong focus on corporate customers
• Exceptional knowledge and understanding of corporate customer needs, risk and compliance
• Customer-oriented and excellent communication skills; making it easy for you to interact with people in an intercultural and diverse environment
• You're self-accountable and solution-oriented, with a hands-on mindset, a positive, entrepreneurial, and agile spirit, and the willingness to accept challenges
• Experience with data analysis tools such as SQL or Tableau preferred
• If you're fluent in English and German and want to be part of a dynamic and passionate team that's dedicated to improving the customer experience, we encourage you to apply now. Let's make a difference together

Our Offer
• We are a team who lives and breathes innovation and digital transformation and likes to push boundaries to the next level.
• We are open minded, supportive and always ready to go the extra mile for our customers
• We take care of your personal wellbeing, career development, and we actively support your educational needs
• Discover and enjoy the benefits of Erste Group
• The minimum wage for this full-time position in accordance with the collective agreement with complete fulfillment of the functional profile is EUR 44.567,-- gross per year. But this is just a formality - we would be happy to talk about your actual salary in person!
• We offer our employees the opportunity to divide their hours between working from home and at the office.
• Erste Group considers the diversity of its employees as key to innovation and success. As employer we are proud to offer everyone equal chances, irrespective of age, skin colour, religious belief, gender, sexual orientation or origin

title: Data Analyst (m/w/d)
via: via ProSiebenSat.1 Jobs - ProSiebenSat.1 Media SE
description:
Teaser

Als Teil des Data Products Teams bei marktguru kannst du deiner Leidenschaft für Fakten und Zahlen nachgehen. Mit deinem Talent hilfst du uns, Daten umfassend aufzubereiten und präzise Berichte über das Marktgeschehen in Deutschland und Österreich zu erstellen. Du bist mit der Zusammenführung und der Analyse von Daten unterschiedlicher Quellen betraut und unterstützt so unsere Kunden mit einer relevanten Basis für ihre Entscheidungen.

Das erwartet dich bei uns
• Du übernimmst die Aufbereitung und Transformation von Daten, um diese u. a. in BI Dashboards zu integrieren, neu zu erstellen oder zu pflegen
• Du generierst umfassende und aussagekräftige Visualisierungen für interne und externe Kommunikation
• Du kommentierst und interpretierst Daten und Darstellungen präzise und objektiv
• Als Teamplayer arbeitest du eng mit allen internen Abteilungen bei marktguru als auch externen Partnern zusammen und bietest Unterstützung bei datenbezogenen Fragen
• Du extrahierst gerne Daten... aus verschiedenen Quellen um diese zu transformieren und zu visualisieren und liebst es, dein Wissen rund um Qlik Sense, SQL oder Python zu erweitern, um neue Erkenntnisse zu generieren

Das bringst du mit
• Du bringst ein ausgezeichnetes analytisches Verständnis und Erfahrung in der Aufbereitung, Analyse und Visualisierung komplexer Daten mit
• Du liebst es, in Daten und Zahlen einzutauchen und hast Erfahrung mit BI-Tools, wie vorzugsweise Qlik Sense oder anderen wie Power BI oder Tableau
• Du hast sehr gute SQL-Kenntnisse und weißt, wie man Daten in einer Datenbank wie z. B. MySQL transformiert und speichert; zudem hast du idealerweise auch schon Erfahrung mit Python gesammelt
• Du verfügst idealerweise über mehrjährige Erfahrung in einer ähnlichen Position, bevorzugt im digitalen Umfeld
• Du arbeitest gerne im agilen Umfeld in einem motivierten Team und hast schon praktische Erfahrungen mit Methoden wie Scrum oder Kanban sammeln können

Das bieten wir dir
• Du wirst Teil eines internationalen, motivierten und zielstrebigen Teams
• Wir leben ein offenes Miteinander, in dem jeder seine Stärken optimal einbringen kann
• Wir sind ein innovatives und erfolgreiches Unternehmen in einer wachstums- und zukunftsorientierten Branche
• Startup-Strukturen mit flachen Hierarchien und engagierten Kollegen
• Vergünstigungen bei unterschiedlichen Partnern und Marken sowie attraktive Mitarbeiterangebote und Schulungen bei der P7S1 Academy
• Offene Unternehmenskultur ohne Dresscode
• Zentrales Büro in München oder Wien, Homeoffice möglich

Abbinder

Du hast Lust auf diese neue berufliche Herausforderung? Überzeuge uns und bewirb dich noch heute: recruiting@marktguru.de. Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung!

marktguru ist Betreiber der gleichnamigen, vielfach prämierten Smart-Shopping-App, die zu den beliebtesten und meistgenutzten Verbraucher-Services im deutsch-sprachigen Internet zählt.
Das Technologieunternehmen mit Sitz in München ist 2016 als Pionier im Bereich Digitale Prospekte und Einzelangebote im deutschen Markt gestartet. Den Verbrauchern bietet marktguru täglich tausende von Top-Vorteilsangeboten mit umfangreichen Sparmöglichkeiten beim Einkaufen, egal ob im stationären oder im Online-Handel. Als kostenloser Einkaufsplaner und -helfer für Millionen Nutzer stellt marktguru (App und Web) aktuelle Informationen (Prospekte, Angebote und Aktionen) von Top-Marken aus allen relevanten Bereichen des täglichen Bedarfs bereit und kombiniert diese mit innovativen Location-based-Nutzerservices und einem leistungsstarken Cashback-System.

Unternehmenstext

Informiere dich hier über die ProSiebenSat.1 Group und unser vielseitiges Portfolio.

Du hast eine Behinderung und möchtest dich bewerben? Dann bist du bei uns herzlich willkommen.
Wir wissen, dass wir noch nicht gänzlich barrierefrei sind, aber wir arbeiten daran. Lass uns darüber reden, wie wir diese Barriere gemeinsam abschaffen und wenn nötig eine individuelle Lösung finden können.

Ausschließlich aus Gründen der besseren Lesbarkeit wird nur die männliche Form verwendet. Selbstverständlich sind immer alle Geschlechter angesprochen

title: Data Analyst Sales-Controlling (ab 30h)
description:
talentbase .tech such derzeit für einen führenden Energievertrieb welcher seine Kunden in allen Bereichen der Energienutzung mit einem umfassenden Leistungsangebot unterstützt.Aufgaben
• Du unterstützt bei der Datenintegration, Vertriebsdatenanalyse und -controlling.
• Du visualisierst und analysierst die Vertriebs KPIs (key performance indicators) um Verbesserungspotential und Handlungsempfehlungen abzuleiten.
• Du bist ein Ansprechpartner für die Vertriebssoftware.
• Applikationskonfiguration und -weiterentwicklung, Systemtests und Systemqualitätsmanagement.
• Qualitätsmanagement: Plausibilitätsprüfungen, Prozessanalyse.
• Schnittstelle zu allen Unternehmensbereichen und zu Softwarelieferanten.
• Entwicklung von Reports und Reporting mit Business Intelligence Lösungen auf Basis von SQL (Qlik-View).Qualifikation

Erforderlich
• SQL

Hilfreich
• Databases
• Qlik ViewBenefits

Du arbeitest in einem kleinen Team mit zwei erfahrenen Kollegen mit technischem, aber auch... Vertriebscontrolling-Hintergrund. Gemeinsam mit Kollegen aus dem Data Science Team besprichst du Möglichkeiten und Potenziale zur Verbesserung der Vertriebssteuerung und des Produktmanagements.

Dies ist eine Stelle von Talentbase .tech! Mit einem professionellen Lebenslauf-Generator ermöglicht Talentbase .tech einfache Bewerbungen für Junior-Tech-Jobs mit nur einem Klick

title: Data Analyst - Urgent Role
description:
We are hiring a motivated Data Analyst to join our incredible team at WEB Windenergie AG in Wien.
Growing your career as a Full Time Data Analyst is a terrific opportunity to develop productive skills.
If you are strong in project management, problem-solving and have the right drive for the job, then apply for the position of Data Analyst at WEB Windenergie AG today!

Deine Rolle im Team
• Perform data-based analysis of power markets
• Provide tools for the valuation of different (hybrid/residual) generation and consumption profiles
• Support the implementation and operation of a portfolio management system
• Support the implementation and operation of an earnings and risk reporting system
• Support the origination, valuation and execution of PPAs with traders and utilities
Technologien und Skills
• Python
• Power BI
Unsere Erwartungen an dich:
Qualifikationen
• Expertise in quantitative analysis
• Fluency in the application of statistical methodology
• Understanding of power markets... is a plus
• Proven competence in the operation of software for the management and analysis of time series and other data (e.g. MS Excel, MS Power Query / Power BI, R, Python)
• Excellent command of MS office
• You can operate self-sufficiently, provide reliable results and own responsibility for your work
Ausbildung
• Relevant degree from FH or university or industry experience
Benefits
• Flexible Arbeitszeiten
• Team Events
• Bonuszahlungen
• Home Office

Benefits of working as a Data Analyst in Wien:

● Excellent benefits
● Advancement opportunities
● Attractive package

title: Data Analyst
description:
Werde Teil eines jungen und aufstrebenden Teams und arbeite an internationalen CRM-Projekten mit! Bei allUpp sind wir stets bemüht, das Beste für unsere Kund:innen herauszuholen. Als Data Analyst hilfst du uns dabei, Unternehmensprozesse zu analysieren und zu optimieren und das Potenzial unserer Kund:innen voll auszuschöpfen. Zusammen mit Salesforce CRM, einem der erfolgreichsten CRM-Systeme weltweit, machen wir Unternehmen fit für das digitale Zeitalter.
WAS DICH ERWARTET
Du optimierst datengetriebene Geschäftsprozesse in enger Zusammenarbeit mit dem jeweiligen Prozessverantwortlichen
Du bist verantwortlich für die systematische Erhebung, Aufbereitung und Auswertung von Daten und Statistiken
Koordiniere und realisiere abwechslungsreiche Migrationsprojekte mittels ETL-Prozessen und Integrationen
Bleibe am Puls der Zeit und informiere dich stetig über neue Data Analytics Strategien & Tools. Bewerte dessen Benefits und finde Anwendungsbereiche, die allUpp und unsere Kund:innen im... Business weiterbringen
Du hast die Möglichkeit nach eigenem Wunsch auch kleinere, abwechslungsreiche Projekte zu leiten und zu verantworten
Bringe deine Ideen und deine Erfahrung ins Unternehmen ein und gestalte aktiv an Veränderungsprozessen mit
Du hast die Chance dich kontinuierlich fachlich durch Salesforce Zertifizierungen weiterzuentwickeln
DEINE QUALIFIKATIONEN
Hochschulabschluss oder vergleichbares (insb. Wirtschaftsinformatik, Informatik, Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen, Medienwissenschaften, Prozessmanagement, BWL)
Kenntnisse in Reporting & Data Analytics, sowie mit SQL-Datenbankabfragen
Erfahrungen mit ERP, salesforce.com oder anderer CRM Systeme wünschenswert
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift
Ausgeprägte analytische sowie kommunikative Fähigkeiten
Eigenverantwortliche, genaue, strukturierte und zielorientierte Arbeitsweise
Begeisterung für neue Technologien & die Ambition “über den Tellerrand” hinauszuschauen
UNSER ANGEBOT
Du bist Teil eines jungen und dynamischen Teams mit motivierendem Teamspirit und der Möglichkeit zur persönlichen Entfaltung in einer flachen Organisationsstruktur
Bringe deine Ideen ohne komplizierte Zwischenwege ein
Abwechslungsreiche eigenverantwortliche Tätigkeiten
Moderne, bestens ausgestattete Büros in Graz und Wien. Du bist lieber im Homeoffice oder arbeitest lieber Remote – kein Problem!
Frei einteilbare Arbeitszeit: Wichtig ist nur, dass du dich mit deinem Team abstimmen und Deadlines einhalten kannst.
Nervennahrung: gratis Snacks (Süßes und Gesundes), Kaffee, Tee und Säfte stehen dir im Büro zur Verfügung.
Ein großartiges Team – freue dich auf jede Menge Spaß bei Firmenevents, Ausflügen oder auf gemütliche Feierabend Aktivitäten.
Lunch Support via Edenred Card
Öffi-Ticket oder Unterstützung zum Klimaticket
Die Kosten von Salesforce Zertifizierungen werden von uns übernommen
Gehalt 49.000,- Brutto/Jahr (38,5h), je nach Qualifikation Überzahlung möglich

title: Data Analyst:in
description:
Als eine der führenden Versicherungen wissen wir, dass wir gemeinsam mehr bewegen können. Bei UNIQA sind wir deshalb die Gemeinschaft für ein besseres Leben. Wir nutzen unsere individuellen Fähigkeiten, um zusammen eine bessere Zukunft zu gestalten. Erzähle uns von deinen Stärken und bewirb dich als Data Analyst:in für das Team Vertriebssteuerung im Bereich Performancemanagement Österreich.

Das Erwartet Dich
• Selbständige Erstellung und Weiterentwicklung von Auswertungen und statistischen Analysen
• Datenaufbereitung und Datenanalyse
• Interpretation, Visualisierung und Kommunikation von Ergebnissen und statistischen Analysen
• Ermittlung von Kennzahlen, Erstellen von Forecasts und Planungen, Monitoring
• Mitarbeit bei unterschiedlichen Projekten

Wir Erwarten Uns
• Betriebswirtschaftliche und/oder technische Ausbildung
• Programmierkenntnisse wünschenswert (vorzugsweise SAS und/oder SQL),
• Ausgezeichnete MS Office 365 Kenntnisse, MS Power BI Kenntnisse sind wünschenswert
•... Selbständige, konstruktive Arbeitsweise, sowie Flexibilität
• Teamfähigkeit, Einsatz- und Weiterbildungsbereitschaft
• Offene Persönlichkeit, Freude an der Weitergabe von Wissen
• Grundlegende Versicherungskenntnisse wünschenswert
• Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englisch-Kenntnisse

Competencies: Effektive Lösungen finden; Arbeitet mit anderen zusammen; Handlungsorientiert; Kundenorientierung

Du Passt Zu Uns, Wenn Du

einfache und realisierbare Lösungen findest

Freude an der Zusammenarbeit mit anderen Menschen hast

handlungsorientiert agierst und aus Fehlern lernst

Kund:innenbedürfnissen oberste Priorität zuschreibst

Wir bei UNIQA leben Vielfalt. Wir setzen auf unterschiedliche Perspektiven in unseren Teams und Führungspositionen. Daher freuen wir uns sehr über Bewerbungen, die unsere Vielfalt bereichern.

Du bist dir nicht sicher, ob dein Profil unseren Anforderungen entspricht? Bewirb dich trotzdem! UNIQA sucht nach Kandidat:innen mit Ambition, Mut zur Veränderung und Begeisterungsfähigkeit

title: Data Analyst
description:
Your role in the team
• You take over the preparation and transformation of data in order to integrate, create or maintain them in BI dashboards, among other things.
• You generate comprehensive and meaningful visualizations for internal and external communication
• You comment and interpret data and representations precisely and objectively.
• As a team player, you work closely with all internal departments at marktguru as well as external partners and offer support with data-related questions.
• You like to extract data from different sources in order to transform and visualize them and you love to expand your knowledge about Qlik Sense, SQL or Python.

Technologies and skills
• MySQL
• Android
• iOS
• Qlik Sense
• Python
• SQL
• Power BI

Our expectations:

Experience
• You bring an excellent analytical understanding and experience in the preparation, analysis and visualization of complex data.
• You love to delve into data and numbers and have experience with BI tools, preferably... Qlik Sense or others like Power BI or Tableau.
• You have very good knowledge of SQL and know how to enter data in a database such as B. MySQL transforms and stores; In addition, ideally you have already gained experience with Python.
• Ideally, you have at least 3 years of experience in a similar position, preferably in a digital environment.
• You like working in an agile environment in a motivated team and have already gained practical experience with methods such as Scrum or Kanban.

Benefits
• Massage, Yoga, etc.
• Coffee, Tea, etc.
• * Public Transport Allowance
• Fresh Fruit

title: Senior Data Analyst (w/m/x)
description:
Arbeitsort: südliches Wien

Unser Kunde ist ein Anbieter von KI-basierten Cloud Lösungen für multinationale Unternehmen. Für den Standort Mödling (Bahnhofsnähe) suchen wir einen Senior Data Analyst, welcher die Daten im Auge behält, managed und optimal für die Kunden darstellst.

Sie fühlen sich angesprochen? Bewerben Sie sich jetzt!

Aufgaben
• Analyse und Transformation großer Datenmengen (auch im Zusammenhang mit Kreditorenprozessen)
• Datenvisualisierung durch Dashboards und Diagramme
• Umsetzung von Prozessoptimierungen
• Überwachung und Prüfung der Qualität von Datenmengen

Profil
• Erfahrung mit Power BI, DAX oder ähnlichen Tools
• Kenntnisse und Freude in der Datenvisualisierung sowie -modellierung
• Erfahrung mit Finanzprozessen wünschenswert
• Sehr gute Englisch- sowie Deutschkenntnisse

Wir bieten
• Starke Mitgestaltungmöglichkeit und hohe Verantwortungsübernahme
• Internationales Arbeitsumfeld
• Fachliche Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten

Interesse an einem Austausch? Dann... buche gerne ein unverbindliches Gespräch unter diesem Link:

Benefits
• Firmenevents
• Gute Anbindung
• Modernes Büro
• Obst
• Öffentliche Erreichbarkeit
• Onboarding
• Parkplatz
• Teamevents
• Tischkicker
• Weiterbildungen

Gehalt
Das Gehalt liegt zwischen € 4000 und € 5500 Brutto pro Monat (Vollzeit) - je nach Qualifikation und Erfahrung
